resources.string: Your device is operating in synchronized mode, these settings will not be propogated to the central server and may not represent the entire dataset. Any changes you make here will be local changes only and may be overwritten upon synchronization. For more information please see the SanteDB documentation.
Are you sure you want to delete this user?
Are you sure you want to reactivate this user?
Are you sure you want to lock this user account?
Are you sure you want to unlock this user account?
This action cannot be performed on a system user
Are you sure you want to reactivate this user account?
Are you sure you want to reset this user's invalid login count?
Username is already taken by another user
Are you sure you want to delete this group?
Are you sure you want to reactivate this group?
Are you sure you want to delete this policy? Note that the policy will continue to be applied on any existing objects which are associated with it.
Are you sure you want to reactivate this policy?
Once saved, your policy cannot be edited. This is to ensure the consistency of audits
Are you sure you want to set this device's secret? (the device may need to be re-configured after this action)
Are you sure you wish to unlock this device account?
Are you sure you wish to lock this device account?
Are you sure you wish to reset this device invalid login attempts counter?
Are you sure you want to set this applications's secret? (the device may need to be re-configured after this action)
Are you sure you want to lock out this application?
Are you sure you want to unlock this application?
Are you sure you want to reset the invalid authentications for this application?
Once removed, this certificate will no longer be mapped to this security object. Are you sure?
This screen is used to update or remove applet solutions from the iCDR instance. An applet is a packaged and digitally signed file which contains new features and functions in SanteDB.
Are you sure you want to remove the applet {id} from the server?
Failed to upload applet solution to server
Are you sure you want to disable this service?
Are you sure you want to enable this service?
The specified service change has been made. You may need to restart the gateway for this change to take effect.
Are you sure you want to re-activate the identity domain?
Identity domain has been updated successfully
Are you sure you want to manually run this job?
Are you sure you want cancel this running job?

This modal allows you to register or activate a SanteDB background job which was not otherwise activated on application startup. The SanteDB iCDR or dCDR will attempt to register the job and will update your configuration.
Are you sure you want to register {job} with this instance of SanteDB?
Enter a brief description of the bug you've encountered.
Enter the discrete steps you took before the error appeared
Attach my log file (if you get an error un-check this)
Attach contents of last error message
Please fill out all fields with a * beside them
You must be online to submit a bug
Are you sure you want to resubmit all objects in {queue} for re-dispatch?
Are you sure you want to PURGE all objects in {queue}? These messages will be erased forever.
Are you sure you want to disable this subscription? The remote endpoint will stop receiving notifications from this instance of SanteDB
Are you sure you want to enable this subscription? The remote endpoint will begin receiving notifications from this instance of SanteDB
Are you sure you want to delete this subscription?

Use this form to upload a external data file in a supported format (example: CSV) to the SanteDB server. SanteDB will validate your submission and will process the import when the next scheduled import job runs.
Select a compatible file from your computer to upload
Select the type of file you are uploading. This will instruct the SanteDB server to use a specific series of import rules for your file
Add descriptive notes about this upload
Error submitting external data to server
Are you sure you want to delete this data submission? (note: this will not remove any already imported data)
Are you sure you want to reschedule this import? If there are errors which have not been corrected, the import may not succeed again.
Running scheduled import jobs started successfully
You are about to export a dataset containing this place and all its descendants. This may take up to 2 minutes, are you sure?
Are you sure you want to remove the association between this place and {id}?
Are you sure you want to delete this place?
Are you sure you want to purge this place?
Are you sure you want to un-delete this place?
Are you sure you want to remove the management role for {user}?
Are you sure you want to promote this staff member to manager?
Staff member has been promoted successfully
Would you like to add this user to the local administrators group?
Are you sure you want to remove the staff member {user} from this facility? (note: any management role will also be removed)
Are you sure you want to delete this organization?
Are you sure you want to purge this organization?
Are you sure you want to un-delete this organization?
The entity you are attempting to add to this entity already has a Parent. Do you want to reassign this entity to a new parent?
Child entity could not be associated - {e}
Are you sure you want to remove this child?
Child entity could not be removed - {e}

Editing the parent of an entity after it is created may have unintended consequences for other data element which use this information. You will also need to correct any addressing information on this entity - are you sure you want to change the parent of this entity?
Select an X509 certificate file (a CER or DER encoded file) to be associated with this object

Assigning one or more authentication certificates will allow this application, uesr or device to authenticate over HTTPS by presenting one of the valid certificates in this list. You can assign an authentication certificate by selecting a certificate file and uploading it

Assigning one or more signing certificates allows SanteDB to validate digital signatures provided by this authenticated device/user/application. These digital signatures may appear on FHIR resources via provenance headers, SanteDB VRP QR codes, or other places. You can assign a signing certificate by selecting a certificate file and uploading it
Are you sure you want to remove this term from this code system?
Reference term {mnemonic} removed successfully
Reference term {authority} saved successfully
Select a CSV file from your local computer
Select the language which the description / code name appears in your file
Your file was uploaded however there are {issue} detected problems - do you want to open the detailed import log to see what these issues are?
Are you sure you want to delete the code system?
Are you sure you want to un-delete this code system?

You can use this function to upload a CSV file which contains a list of reference terms that you would like added to this code system.

The requirements for the uploaded file are:

  • File must be in CSV format
  • First row must contain column headers with the name of each column
  • You can use any columns you like, but there must be present:
    • Mnemonic (required) - Containing the mnemonic of the refernece term (how it appears on the wire)
    • Name (required) - The default display name for the concept
    • Concept (optional) - The mnemonic of the concept in SanteDB's internal concept dictionary which should be mapped (if it exists) or created (if it does not)
    • Mapping (optional) - The mapping type to the concept wither SameAs, InverseOf, NegationOf, WiderThan, or NarrowerThan
  • File must be smaller than the maximum upload size configured by your system administrator

Deleting a concept set which is used by the SanteDB may result in drop-down selectors not functioning properly, database validation scripts failing, and plugins becoming unresponsive. You should only delete user-defined concept sets which were deleted in error. Are you sure you want to delete this concept set?
Are you sure you want to un-delete this concept set?
Include or exclude concepts from another concept set in this concept set
Directly add a concept to this concept set
Upload a comma-separated file (CSV) to bulk populate this concept set

!!!DANGER!!! This concept set appears to be created by the SanteDB SYSTEM account. Removing concepts from system concept sets may cause issues in SanteDB validation processes. Are you sure you wish to continue?
Are you sure you wish to remove this concept from the concept set?
Concept was successfully removed from the concept set

When a concept set is composed, it means that it is derived from other concept sets in the SanteDB server. For example, MaterialTypes may be a union of VaccineMaterialTypes and DrugMaterialTypes, with the exclusion of ForbiddenMaterialTypes

Note: When composing sets, a Exclude All operation takes highest priority. Additionally, you cannot compose a set of other composed sets

Select comma separated file (CSV) with the concepts (new or existing) which are to be assigned to this concept set. The CSV should have the format:

  • Mnemonic (Required) - The unique concept mnemonic for the concept (if the mnemonic matches an existing concept it will be used)
  • Class (Required) - The general classification of the concept one of Other, Status, Relationship, UnitOfMeasure, Route, Finding, Problem, or Form (hint: Other is recommended for most concepts)
  • Name (Optional) - The name of the code in the selected language on the upload

Your upload can contain other columns, however they will be ignored
The comma-save (CSV) file to be imported
The language of the <code>Name<code> column in the file
Are you sure you want to delete the identified concept?
Are you sure you want to un-delete this concept?
Are you sure you want to remove this concept relationship?
Concept relationship has been deleted successfully
Concept relationship has been created successfully
A concept relationship is used to link one or more concepts together. For example, instructing the CDR that two concepts have the same meaning or that one is a narrower concept than another.
Enabling or Disabling match configurations while a background match task is running is not advised, and can result in unpredictable results
Are you sure you want to enable match configuration {id}? It will be used to score future registration and re-matches
Match configuration {id} could not be enabled ({e})
Are you sure you want to enable match configuration {id}? It will be used to score future registration and re-matches
Are you sure you want to disable match configuration {id}? It will no longer be used to score matches
Match configuration {id} could not be disabled ({e})
Are you sure you want permanently delete match configuration {id}? After deletion it can not be retrieved.
Match configuration {id} could not be deleted ({e})
A match configuration with id {id} already exists (created by {author}). Do you want to overwrite the current configuration with this empty configuration? (This cannot be undone)
This match configuration does not have any scoring attributes! You cannot set the classification score ranges until the match configuration has at least one scoring attribute
This match configuration does not contain any block statements or filters. Use the ADD button to create a block statement.

Hmmm - something seems off with your weight configuration. If your M value is less than your U value the match score will be negative. If this attribute is a negative indicator of a match (i.e. you intend this) you can ignore this message. Otherwise it is recommended you check your M and U values
These are comments/notes by the author of the match configuration which provide context to the blocking instruction.
Indicates that the specified filter should only be evaluated when the $input record contains a value at the specified property location

The HDSI guard expression to apply to the database. Note: This expression is translated to SQL statements - the functions used in your expression must be compatible with the expressions supported on the database technology being used.
When the incoming record ($input) has property WHEN then the FILTER is applied. See HDSI Query Syntax on the SanteSuite WIKI
This match configuration does not contain any attributes for scoring. Use the ADD button to create a scoring statement
Set the patient which will be used as the $input of the match test run. This is the simulated patient registration/update event which will be passed to the test service.

Specifies one or more other records which you want to test against the $input - if no objects are specified here, the match engine will perform an entire block. Use this option if you're attempting to diagnose scoring results with particular record pairs
This attribute was evaluated - the score is an actual evaluation of A and B
This attribute was not evaluated - the score represents the whenNull configuration option
Excessive results in blocking result

The proportion of results which are non-matches ({NonMatch}) was the majority of records blocked ({count}). This indicates that your blocking configuration is too liberal. Try reducing the number of NonMatch by adding more stringent blocking criteria to your dataset.
Blocking may be too restrictive

Your blocking configuration resulted in no records being retrieved from the database. This may indicate that your blocking configuration is too stringent. Try using levenshtein or soundex or other fuzzy matching to your blocking configuration to allow querying of more records.
Check your Scoring Weights

The median score ({median}) is higher than the average score ({avg}), this might indicate that your scoring may be too stringent. Try:
  • Ensuring your U values are appropriate (for example: if using genderConcept then your U should be close to 0.5)
  • Ensure that your extractions and partial scores are applied properly (for example: Ensure that appropriate extract functions are applied, and proper thresholds apply
  • Ensure your exclusion or when conditions are appropriate
)
There doesn't appear to be a registered resource viewer for Match, ensure that the appropriate plugins are configured for this environment
This operation will run a re-matching process for this record. Are you sure?

Your blocking criteria has returned a large number of results ({count}) from the database. This may have serious performance impacts if scoring requires complex criteria. Consider adding more blocking criteria to speed up your matching configuration

Specifies how blocked records should be filtered and loaded. Options are:
  • MASTER (default) - Instructs the blocking to be considered on the MASTER record (i.e. the collection of sources)
  • LOCAL/SOURCE - Instructs the blocking to be considered on SOURCE records (this is faster but ignore instructions may be less accurate)
PERSISTENCE LAYER - Blocking occurs against the persistence layer without using the data management pattern configured
REPOSITORY LAYER - Blocking occurs against the repository layer using the data management pattern configured
Use PERSISTENCE LAYER blocking. This may result in better performance however generated properties or combined properties of the master may not be considered

This page shows the master list of all registered Clinical Decision Support (CDSS) libraries in your installation of SanteDB. These libraries form the basis of any clinical protocols, decision support rules, and facts. Please be sure to read the CDSS Documentation on the SanteSuite Wiki before modifying these rules, as they may have an adverse impact on patient care.

Select a CDSS library definition file from your hard drive to import into the SanteDB instance. If you upload a file with an identifier or UUID matching an existing library, this will update the existing file, otherwise the library will be imported

This tool is used to upload a new version of this CDSS library using a raw definition file. This option is useful if you are authoring your CDSS rules using the CDSS XML library format or the CDSS text format. This method of maintaining a CDSS library is preferred, since it provides complete access to the CDSS engine's functionality. Before continuing, please consult the CDSS Documentation on the SanteSuite Wiki for more information about these formats.
Cannot publish an invalid CDSS file. Please ensure all validation errors are corrected
Are you sure you want to publish this CDSS definition? Note: If your CDSS definition lists a state of ACTIVE it will apply to all patient encounters on this system
CDSS definition has been published successfully to the server

Use the source editor to change the CDSS definition. Shortcuts:

  • CTRL+F: Find
  • CTRL+H: Find/Replace
  • CTRL+S: Save/Publish
  • F12: Go to definition
  • F9: Run/Test Library
  • CTRL+U: Convert text to upper case
  • CTRL+SHIFT+U: Convert text to lower case
Select the type of object against which the rules will tested
Select whether the test object will be an arbitrary object (specified by you) or an existing record from the database
CDSS libraries, rules and protocols can obtain interactive data from the evaludation session via parameters. Use this area to input any parameters that your CDSS library may use.
computed proposals shown below. Please reduce the output of your library, or include more restrictive inputs
The file that was exported from another SanteDB iCDR instance or a file which your development partner has prepared for you
Are you sure you want to purge this data quality configuration? It cannot be restored after this action
Data quality configuration has been successfully purged
Could not purge data quality rule: {error}
Are you sure you want to delete this data quality configuration?
Data quality configuration has been successfully deleted
Could not delete data quality rule: {error}
Are you sure you want to restore this data quality configuration? (it will be deactivated prior to restore)
Data quality configuration has been successfully restored
Could not restore data quality rule: {error}
Data quality rule has been saved successfully

Creating Materials

This screen allows you to create a new classification of material which is used within the SanteDB CDR. A classification of material or Material does not represent a specific instance of a material (for example: Moderna mRNA SARS nCOV Vaccine), rather it is used to express the classification of a material (i.e. mRNA SARS nCOV Vaccine).

This classification of a material is then instantiated into a ManufacturedMaterial which carries information such as Lot #, Expiration Date, GTIN and more.

Administrators should familiarize themselves with the SanteDB Conceptual Information Model prior to changing the values in this screen
Are you sure you want to delete this material definition?
Material definition has been successfully deleted
Are you sure you wish to re-activate this material definition?
Material definition has been successfully restored

This form will create or edit a manufactured product for the material type. In SanteDB, this material product definition contains information for an orderable/consumable product. Products typically have a Trade Name which is a common name represented on the product vial. Additioanlly each product will represent a certain quantity of a particular material for which it is a product. For example, if the manufactured product comes in 5 dose vials then you will set the quantity per material to 5, you should then set the quantity on this product to 1 VIAL
Material product has been saved sucessfully
Are you sure you want to delete this product definition?

In SanteDB, a Material represents the generic concept, a Product represents a specific type of the Material which is manufactured. A Lot/Batch number represents a particular instance of the Product that has been produced and is administered to patients.
Are you sure you want to delete this lot/batch?
Material lot/batch has been successfully deleted

Extension type has been deleted successfully
